page.title: 18The River Winterborne
page.content: As the name suggests this river only flows fully in the Winter, when it often floods. It flows East, joining the Frome which enters Poole Harbour. In the past the flooding of the water meadows was controlled by hatches and cuts. Flooding was carried out for short periods in Winter and Spring to give a good early bite for sheep. Alongside the river were some marshy places where Withy Beds were grown There are remnants of these to be seen today, but they are overgrown and neglected. In the river are fish and invertebrates providing food for other animals such as Kingfishers and the occasional Heron. The river dries completely in Summer, but there is plenty of water below ground, and there are two ponds with the usual variety of wildlife such as frogs, reeds and insects.
